conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine collision time.
Graph shows velocity of Car A and Car B over time; Car A starts at 25 m/s, Car B at 15 m/s, both decelerate.
Calculate deceleration of Car A as -1 m/s².
Calculate deceleration of Car B as -0.6 m/s².
Calculate distance traveled by Car A using \( s_A = 25t - \frac{1}{2}(1)t^2 \).
Calculate distance traveled by Car B using \( s_B = 15t - \frac{1}{2}(0.6)t^2 \).
Set collision condition: \( s_A = s_B + d \).
Substitute expressions for \( s_A \) and \( s_B \) and simplify to \( 0.2t^2 - 10t + d = 0 \).
At \( t = 20 \) seconds, Car A's velocity is 5 m/s and Car B's velocity is 3 m/s.
Calculate initial distance \( d = 90 \, \text{m} \) using area under graphs.
Substitute \( d = 90 \) into equation and solve quadratic equation.
Solve quadratic equation to find \( t = 38.23 \) or \( t = 11.77 \).
Conclude cars collide at \( t = 11.77 \) seconds, before 20 seconds.
